intro: Eupatoriophalacron album, commonly known as the white eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy white flowers that bloom in dense clusters, typically during the summer months. Its foliage is usually opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Eupatoriophalacron album is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
